business.headline: Sensex, Nifty start week on a positive note as IT stocks lead the chargeBroader market indices were also in the green, mirroring the positive start. The tone was set by IT heavyweights: Tech Mahindra and Infosys jumped over 2% each, followed closely by gains in HCLTech and Wipro. Eicher Motors also featured among the early winners.

TCS suffers legal setback in US with $194 million penalty upheldThe matter has now been sent back to the Northern District of Texas, Dallas Division, which has been asked to review the injunction as per the directions of the Appeals Court.

Explained: Why billionaire Lakshmi Mittal is saying goodbye to the UKAs per the Forbes rich list, Mittal has a net worth of $21.4 billion. He is the 12th richest Indian and the 104th richest person in the world.

New labour codes: 10 key changes every employee should knowWhether someone works full-time, on a contract, or in sector-specific roles like media, plantations or factories, the new framework affects nearly everyone. Here are the key updates workers should be aware of, along with several other important changes that haven't received enough attention.

Feel cheated by your family will? Know your legal rightsWhether it is a sudden change in beneficiaries, unequal division of property, or doubts about the person's mental state when the will was written, such situations often create confusion, anger, and emotional stress.

Want to clear your home loan early? Simple ways to pay it off quicklyPay low EMIs and your tenure stretches, increasing your interest costs. Pay higher EMIs, and you could save years and lakhs on the total interest you pay.

New labour codes are here: Will your in-hand salary rise or fall?With the new labour codes now implemented, many employees are trying to understand what it means for their salary structure, especially basic salary, PF deductions and take-home pay.

New labour codes: What changes for paid leave, work hours and health benefitsThe new labour codes apply across sectors and are designed to improve safety, reduce fatigue and make workplaces more predictable for millions of workers in India.

Gratuity in a year? Only if you're a fixed-term employee. Here's what it meansOnly employees hired on fixed-term contracts qualify for the new one-year gratuity rule. Permanent staff remain under the five-year norm, making this benefit exclusive to India's expanding fixed-term workforce.

From gratuity to gig worker insurance: What new labour laws mean for employeesFrom gratuity to insurance and safer workplaces, the new rules expand what employees can expect from their jobs. Staying informed will help workers make the most of these changes.

Fixed-term employees to get gratuity after 1 year of service under new labour lawsAccording to the Union Labour Ministry, the restructuring is aimed at ensuring better wages, wider social security coverage and improved health-related protections for workers across sectors.

Sensex tumbles 400 points, Nifty ends above 26,000 amid volatile tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex fell more than 400 points to close at 85,231, while the NSE Nifty50 managed to stay above the 26,000 mark despite broad-based weakness across sectors.

Government implements four labour codes, replacing 29 old laws. Check detailsThe move brings together decades-old labour rules that were scattered across multiple legislations into a consolidated framework. Many of these older laws date back to the pre-Independence and early post-Independence era.

Rupee slides to record low of Rs 89.45 amid US-India trade uncertaintyThe outlook for the rupee remains uncertain as global risk sentiment stays fragile and investors wait for clearer signals from both the Fed and ongoing trade negotiations between Washington and New Delhi.

Sudeep Pharma IPO fully subscribed on day 1. Check latest GMP and otherThe issue, priced between Rs 563 and Rs 593, saw a clear surge from retail and high-net-worth investors, allowing the company to cross the one-time subscription mark even though institutional participation remained weak through the first session.

How GMP and social media hype mislead so many first-time investorsThe Great IPO Gamble series ends here, and in part 3, we break down how GMP and social media hype influence first-time investors. A look at the noise behind the numbers.

Recipe for trouble? Zomato's customer data move stirs up controversyZomato controversy: Food delivery giant Zomato has decided to share customer data with restaurants after years of tussle. Politicians and marketing gurus have called it a recipe for trouble, expressing concerns about data privacy and spam messages.

Russian Oil: Reliance Halts Russian Crude Imports at Jamnagar SEZ RefineryThis report covers Reliance Industries' decision to halt the import of Russian crude oil for its export-oriented refinery in Jamnagar, Gujarat. The move is in compliance with European Union and United States sanctions targeting Russian oil majors Rosneft and Lukoil, with a wind-down period ending November 21. Reliance stated, 'we'll stay aligned with government's policy.' The company will now source crude from other regions, including West Asia and the EU, for its Special Economic Zone (SEZ) refinery, with all exports to be derived from non-Russian oil starting December 1. The decision impacts a long-term deal between Reliance and Rosneft for the supply of crude oil.

JP Power share price tumbles 7% after strong rally. Why is it down today?The JP Power share price dip reflects profit-taking after a steep run, as the market waits for clearer evidence that the broader group's restructuring will lift the company's long-term fortunes.

Groww shares jump nearly 7% after two-day tumble: What's driving today's rally?Around 10:03 am, the shares of the company were trading 6.30% higher at Rs 166.44 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). The rebound comes amid growing anticipation around Groww's performance.

entertainment.headline: Kevin Spacey denies rumours about being homeless, clarifies his living situation Actor Kevin Spacey addresses recent speculation about his living circumstances, refuting misleading headlines and explaining his current lifestyle, while receiving support from colleagues and fans.

Rebel Saab: Prabhas charms us all with mass dance in The Raja Saab first single The team of 'The Raja Saab' launched its first single 'Rebel Saab' at a fan event in Hyderabad, marking Prabhas's return to the dance floor and highlighting nostalgic elements for fans. Composer Thaman S described the track as a tribute to Prabhas and his screen presence.

RM time to disband BTS joke explained the real story behind his chat with Jimin BTS members RM and Jimin joked about disbanding during a recent livestream, referencing a temporary low viewer count as they interacted with fans ahead of their anticipated March 2026 album release.

Susanthica wins Sa Re Ga Ma Pa Seniors Season 5, takes home Rs 15 lakh and a home Susanthica was crowned the winner of Sa Re Ga Ma Pa Seniors Season 5 at the grand finale on November 23, with Sapesan and Chinnu Senthamilan securing the first and second runner-up positions.

Kyunki Saas Bhi... actor Ashlesha Savant marries Sandeep after 23 years of dating Television actors Ashlesha Savant and Sandeep Baswana got married in an intimate ceremony at the Chandrodaya temple in Vrindavan on November 16, following a 23-year relationship.

JLo raises toast, sets Udaipur wedding ablaze with hits and stunning looks Grammy-winning artist Jennifer Lopez brought a vibrant close to the wedding festivities of Billionaire Netra Mantena in Udaipur, captivating guests with a medley of her popular tracks, dynamic dance routines, and multiple striking outfit changes.

Saying star kids have it easy is stupid: Meezaan Jafri on groupism, opportunities In an exclusive interview with us, Meezaan Jafri opened up about the biggest myths around nepotism and why calling star-kids privileged is "stupid." He spoke about groupism, navigating industry circles, and building a career without gimmicks or PR noise.

Taylor Swift reportedly a high-risk target ahead of wedding to Travis Kelce Singer Taylor Swift's security team is reportedly on high alert as she and Travis Kelce prepare for their upcoming wedding, with concerns rising over potential risks due to the singer's high profile and public appearances.

Rebel Wilson breaks silence after costar sues her over harassment report Actor Rebel Wilson has publicly addressed her legal dispute with 'The Deb' star Charlotte MacInnes, following allegations of sexual harassment involving producer Amanda Ghost.

Donald Glover opens up about stroke and heart condition that halted tour Singer Donald Glover has spoken publicly about the health challenges that forced him to halt his The New World Tour in 2024, revealing he suffered a stroke and underwent heart surgery. The artiste, who returned to the stage recently, provided details about his medical ordeal and discussed his recovery

David Harbour says Stranger Things shattered his idea of who he'd become Actor David Harbour discusses his evolving career, the impact of 'Stranger Things,' and the creative journey with the Duffer brothers, highlighting the shifts in both the series and his own approach over five seasons.

Neha Kakkar lights up Sahitya Aaj Tak grand finale, sings chartbusters The grand finale of Sahitya Aaj Tak 2025 took place at Delhi's Major Dhyan Chand Stadium, where singer Neha Kakkar lit up the evening with her high-energy performance, making the event even more special and entertaining.

Bigg Boss 19 Episode 92: Kunickaa Sadanand evicted days ahead of grand finale After thirteen weeks in the 'Bigg Boss 19' house, Kunickaa Sadanand was evicted following a unique elimination round. The Weekend Ka Vaar episode on Sunday featured guests including Ektaa Kapoor, Fatima Sana Sheikh and Vijay Varma.

Wicked: For Good becomes biggest Broadway film debut with $226M worldwide 'Wicked: For Good', Universal's highly-anticipated musical, has made a remarkable debut at the box office with outstanding earnings and audience response, setting new records for Broadway musical adaptations.

Ranveer Singh says Udaipur played Cupid in his love story with Deepika Padukone Ranveer Singh spoke about the significance of Udaipur in his personal life during the wedding celebrations of Netra Mantena and Vamsi Gadiraju. The actor shared memories from 2013 when he and Deepika Padukone first grew close during a shoot in the city.

Huma Qureshi calls for equal punishment for online abuse: Dirty DMs aren't harmless Huma Qureshi addresses the seriousness of online abuse and calls for stronger action against digital harassment, drawing attention to the need for equal treatment of online and public space offenders.

Vijay Varma: Gustakh Ishq will remind of life before mobile phones Vijay Varma and Fatima Sana Shaikh discussed their upcoming romantic film, 'Gustakh Ishq', at Sahitya Aajtak 2025 on Sunday. The film also features Naseeruddin Shah.

53rd International Emmys: When and where to watch the awards and other details The 53rd International Emmy Awards will take place in New York City on November 24, 2025, honouring standout television from 26 countries, including India. This year, India marks a milestone with 64 nominations, led by 'Amar Singh Chamkila' and Diljit Dosanjh.

Randeep Hooda recalls how Battle of Saragarhi changed him, even without release Actor Randeep Hooda opened up about the deep personal impact of his preparation for the now-shelved film 'Battle of Saragarhi'. He recalled its making during his session on Day 3 of Sahitya Aaj Tak in New Delhi.

general news.headline: Arunachal is part of China: India-born woman 'harassed' at Shanghai airportPrema Wangjom Thongdok, an Arunachal Pradesh–born UK resident, alleged that Chinese immigration officials at Shanghai Pudong Airport declared her Indian passport invalid, detained her for hours, and blocked her onward travel to Japan.

Delhi air pollution protest takes a turn, Maoist Madvi Hidma's posters on displayOn Sunday evening, the protesters at India Gate tried to block traffic and allegedly pepper-sprayed police officers attempting to disperse them, leading to an FIR and a wider probe into how the Madvi Hidma posters surfaced at the demonstration.

How UK is scaring away rich British Indians to DubaiWealthy British Indians, including Lakshmi Mittal, and other high-net-worth entrepreneurs are leaving the UK, citing rising taxes and policy uncertainty under the Labour government. Tech entrepreneur Herman Narula plans to move to Dubai amid buzz over taxes on the super-rich.

Justice Surya Kant takes oath as 53rd Chief Justice of IndiaJustice Surya Kant, part of key rulings on Article 370, the Pegasus case, and electoral reforms, will serve as 53rd Chief Justice of India (CJI) for 15 months until February 2027.

India denied, but Mohsin Naqvi hands Pakistan Asia Cup trophyMohsin Naqvi handed the trophy to Pakistan A after they won the Rising Stars Asia Cup title after beating Bangladesh A in the thrilling final that went into the Super Over in Doha on Sunday. Naqvi, who is the Asian Cricket Council chief, famously denied India the Asia Cup after they beat Pakistan in the final earlier this year.

Maybe we would have run away: Ramaphosa's banter with PM Modi on hosting G20India hosted the 18th G20 summit at Bharat Mandapam in New Delhi in September 2023, when the African Union was added as a permanent member of the group. Ramaphosa said South Africa had closely watched India's stewardship of the group in 2023.

Depressed over US visa rejection, woman doctor dies by suicide in HyderabadAlthough the exact cause of death is yet unknown, the preliminary report suggests that the deceased either had an overdose of sleeping pills or injected herself on Friday night.

Their defiant stand has blunted India's attack, drained overs from the day, and kept the pitch looking flatter than ever. With the clock slipping away and neither side able to force a breakthrough, this Test now appears to be drifting toward an inevitable draw.

The footage, recorded on November 3, has prompted departmental investigation amidst criticism of police handling and adherence to new legal procedures.

More DK Shivakumar loyalists land in Delhi as Karnataka power tussle intensifiesA third group of MLAs loyal to DK Shivakumar rushed to Delhi amid an escalating power tussle, stepping up pressure on the Congress leadership.

India sends students abroad, but can it attract the world back?India's universities can become competitive only when quality, autonomy, and research strength grow together. The world's top institutions succeed because they combine stable funding, independent decision-making, strong faculty, and deep industry ties.

US, Ukraine craft revised peace plan in 'best ever talks' of Trump's tenureThe US and Ukraine have unveiled a revised peace framework to end the war with Russia after high-level Geneva talks, but key issues remain unresolved.

DOGE quietly ceased to exist eight months ahead of schedule: ReportThe DOGE department has quietly stopped functioning months before its mandate expired. Lionel Messi powers Inter Miami to 1st East final, thrash Cincinnati in semis Inter Miami progressed to their first-ever Eastern Conference final following a commanding 4–0 victory over FC Cincinnati. Lionel Messi led with one goal and three assists, while Tadeo Allende and Mateo Silvetti contributed crucial goals. Miami continues their historic playoff run and will next face either Philadelphia or NYCFC.

New Zealand's Kane Williamson returns for West Indies Tests, Jamieson rested Kane Williamson has re-joined New Zealand for the three-Test series against the West Indies, with pacers Blair Tickner and Zak Foulkes included and Kyle Jamieson rested.

Eberechi adds an aura to Arsenal: Arteta praises hat-trick hero after Spurs win Eberechi Eze provided the spark, swagger and "aura" Mikel Arteta insisted Arsenal needed, scoring the first hat-trick of his career to punish Tottenham and send the Gunners six points clear at the top of the Premier League.

KL Rahul to Captain India in ODIs vs South Africa | Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli in SquadThis special report covers the selection of KL Rahul as the captain for the Indian cricket team's upcoming ODI series against South Africa, starting November 29. The squad, announced by the Ajit Agarkar-led selection committee, includes senior players Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma. The report notes the committee 'opted to hand Rahul the captaincy even though Rohit Sharma was available to act as stand-in skipper'. Rahul's appointment comes as regular captain Shubman Gill was ruled out due to a neck injury sustained during a Test match. The team composition also sees pacers Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Siraj being rested for the series, while all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja has been brought in as a replacement for Akshar Patel.

R Ashwin tears into England's Bazball approach: How reckless can you be?Ravichandran Ashwin has criticised England's Bazball approach after their batting collapse in the first Ashes Test in Perth. Ashwin questioned whether high-risk batting is being wrongly justified as positive intent.

Clinical Pakistan hammer Zimbabwe to storm into T20I tri-series finalPAK vs ZIM: Pakistan stormed into the T20I tri-series final with a dominant 69-run win over Zimbabwe, powered by fifties from Sahibzada Farhan and Babar Azam, and Usman Tariq's hat-trick.

Usman Tariq rattles Zimbabwe, becomes 4th Pakistan bowler with Men's T20I hat-trickPAK vs ZIM: Usman Tariq etched his name into Pakistan's cricket history with a brilliant T20I hat-trick against Zimbabwe in Rawalpindi, becoming the country's fourth bowler to achieve the feat.

Smriti Mandhana's Wedding Postponed Due To Father's Medical EmergencyThis special report covers the indefinite postponement of Indian cricketer Smriti Mandhana's wedding to music composer Palash Muchhal. The decision was made following a medical emergency involving her father, Shrinivas Mandhana, who was hospitalised on the morning the ceremony was scheduled to take place. The report states, 'Smriti Mandana has decided that until her father recovers, the wedding which was supposed to happen today will be postponed indefinitely'. The segment includes live inputs from India Today's Nitin Srivastava, who confirms that Mandhana's father is under observation and undergoing tests. The family has requested privacy as they focus on his recovery.

Kuldeep Yadav's stunning take on Guwahati Test pitch: It was road, but no complaintsIND vs SA: Kuldeep Yadav called the Guwahati surface "like a road" as South Africa piled up 489, leaving India chasing time rather than turn. Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli have been named in India's 15-man squad, which features Ravindra Jadeja and Ruturaj Gaikwad.

India bowlers toil as South Africa pile on 489 in GuwahatiIndia vs South Africa, 2nd Test Day 2: Senuran Muthusamy's 109 and Marco Jansen's 93 ensured South Africa added 243 runs for their last four wickets and posted a massive first innings total of 489. India now face an unforgiving equation: bat big, bat fast, and find urgency, or watch South Africa stroll to a series win.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
